description: Our 100% Berkshire, naturally cured, spiral cut hams are like nothing you have ever tasted. The intramuscular fat marbling, natural cure and sweet honey glaze make for one of the best holiday ham experiences you have ever had. The ham comes pre-glazed and wrapped in foil so all you have to do is throw it in the oven, warm it to your desired temp and serve. Not only will it be the best holiday ham you have ever had – it'll be the simplest to prepare and enjoy.

Zerto Fresh Mozzarella is made with nothing but pure, fresh milk. Its creamy texture and mild flavor are much softer than mass-produced regular Mozzarella. This block-style mozzarella is perfect for shredding over homemade pizza, baked pasta dishes, or filling rolls of chicken or veal scallopini.
When determining whether to use Part Skim or Whole Milk mozzarella, a decision has to be made as to the preference of the final dish. Whole milk mozzarella brings a fuller flavor and a creamy texture to recipes, but it does not brown as well and is not as elastic as part skim. Part Skim mozzarella has 2% butterfat, a greater stretch, chewier texture and more browning ability.
ingredients: Made from pasteurized cow's milk.
certification: Varieties Sold Separately. Product of the US.

description:

Bart J. Druery IV is upholding a family mustard tradition crafted in 1888 by his great-grandfather, Augustus Bauer, who sold it from his storefront in Queens, New York. It's still a local favorite after more than 120 years.
tip of the tongue
Ideal for upgrading everyday roast beef sandwiches. Whisk with olive oil for a standout dressing to drizzle on warm potatoes or crisp greens.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
It's no secret that shaking bright-red sriracha onto everything is now a time-honored tradition. And we admit, we're impressed by all the wonderful things people do with the ubiquitous garlicky hot sauce. We're even more impressed that these genius mayo-makers did things the hard way: They build the flavor of sriracha from scratch, blending their creamy, flavorful mayonnaise with hints of vinegar, cayenne and jalapeño peppers, a dash of sugar and plenty of garlic.
All this eggy goodness is the brainchild of Sam Mason, a kitchen alum of acclaimed experimental restaurant WD-50, and Elizabeth Valleau, a designer and marketer (we love the graphic labels!). Mason mixes up their ultra-flavored, cold-infused batches in a small walk-in nestled in the back of the company's tiny Brooklyn storefront. Silky smooth and perfectly emulsified, you'll find yourself making up excuses to grab one of these jars at every meal.
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Slather this mayo on crusty french bread to pair with pickled carrots, jalapeño and soy-marinated hanger steak for a riff on the bânh mi. Add to hamburgers, tomato sandwiches, ham-and-cheese wraps – the possibilities are pretty endless, so maybe this'll be the next big craze!
ingredients: Non-GMO canola oil, cage-free egg yolks, vinegar, cayenne pepper puree, water, organic cane sugar, red jalapeño peppers, organic distilled vinegar, organic dried garlic, cayenne powder, citric acid, salt, xanthan gum, guar gum.
certification: Comes in a 4 oz jar.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Catskill Provisions raw honey is perfect for drizzling into tea or onto Greek yogurt or fresh fruit. Spring honey is mellow and light, while the Fall honey, a beautiful dark amber color, finishes with a spicy hint of molasses. 
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Use the honey to sweeten plain yogurt and top with a handful of crunchy Elemental Granola by Granola Lab — your breakfast will never be the same! In the summer, sweeten iced mint tea with Fall honey syrup (just mix together equal parts of warm water and syrup, stir to dissolve, then chill). In the winter, its spicy complexity makes it perfect for a hot toddy: Stir together hot water, bourbon, a squeeze of fresh lemon and a drizzle of Fall honey.
ingredients: Raw honey.
certification: Comes in a 12 oz jar.

description: This extra-special delicacy from the Gruyere district of Switzerland is well-known as the basic ingredient in fondue. But with its delightfully nutty, spicy, full flavor, it is delicious as a table cheese as well. Upon eating Gruyere, one immediately recognizes the taste of whole milk that is used exclusively in making this grand cheese. We say it is grand because a whole wheel of Gruyere weighs about 80 pounds. In fact, it takes over 100 gallons of milk to make a single wheel of Gruyere! Enjoy this traditional favorite julienned into a chef's salad, melted on a hot open-faced sandwich, or, of course, in a classic cheese fondue.
ingredients: Made from unpasteurized cow's milk.
certification: Won the Silver Medal in the World Cheese Awards.

description: To paraphrase Julia Child, a little butter makes life a lot better. We like to butter up our toast with butter from one of our favorite New England creameries, Vermont Creamery because we know their craftsmanship is top of the cream-line. While working on a dairy farm in Brittany, France, Vermont Creamery's Allison Hooper learned a thing or two about churning cultured cream (crème fraiche) into thick, buttery butter. Churned in small batches, the cream transforms into a rich European-style butter with 86% butterfat and fresh off the farm taste. Cultured Butter is great for baking, pan searing meats, on your toast, and slathered all over...you get the idea. This butter's like buttah. Salted or Unsalted.

description: Nitrate-FREE! We founded our business on our obsession with making great bacon and a passion for heritage pigs. And the most honored legacy of a glorious Tender Belly pig is truly great bacon! The heritage pigs we use for our bacon are from Iowa and are naturally grown: NO antibiotics, NO hormones, NO gestation and NO nitrates or farrowing crates, and fed a 100% vegetarian diet. With their exceptional meat to fat ratio they are the perfect belly. Our signature maple and habañero spice rub is applied, the bellies are dry cured and then cherrywood-smoked to perfection. We spare no expense with ingredients, process or time to give you the best possible product. Remember: BACON, it's good for ya!

description: Our premium bases make it quick and easy to enjoy rich, creamy, homemade gravy—even on weeknights. Our chicken gravy base combines slow-simmered chicken and vegetable stocks with a splash of white wine—the perfect complement to a roast chicken with savory stuffing or roasted or mashed potatoes.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Want all the flavor of bacon without the hassle of actually cooking it? Let us introduce you to our dear friend bacon jam, a whole jar packed with the delectable, salty-sweet flavor of everyone's favorite breakfast meat (sorry, sausage). 
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Bacon turns any dish into party food. Spread a spoonful on a cracker and top with a slice of fresh fig or pear. Make inside-out bacon wrapped dates by filling each date with a spoonful of bacon jam, then baking in a 350 degree oven for 10 minutes. Mix a few tablespoons into mashed potatoes along with some caramelized onions. Really, the possibilities are endless.
ingredients: Bacon (pork, water, salt, cane and maple sugars, sodium phosphate, sodium erythorbate, dextrose, sodium nitrite, smoke), onion, balsamic vinegar of Modena, brown sugar (sugar, invert sugar, cane molasses), salt, soy lecithin, citrus flour, pectin, black pepper.
certification: Contains soy.
Comes in a 7 oz jar.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
No no, it's not the end of days, but a taste of this whiskey is pretty earth-shattering!
Yes, this is a big and brawny whiskey with a rich, full body and tons of black pepper. The alluring hints of chocolate and freshly baked pastry (really!) make it perfect to sip alongside dessert. It's a must-have bottle for rye whiskey fans everywhere.
Here's the deal: Corsair master distiller Darek Bell ferments 80% malted rye and 20% un-malted chocolate rye from local farms, then distills the mash once in an antique still and a second time in a modern copper pot still. It's then aged for around a year in 15 gallon casks before being brought to proof and bottled by hand.
DID YOU KNOW?
100% rye whiskeys are particularly difficult to distill, because the fermented mash is incredibly sticky and hard to handle. We're super impressed that a number of small batch distillers have taken on the challenge, with tasty success!
ingredients: Distilled from 80% malted rye and 20% unmalted chocolate rye; 46% alcohol by volume.
certification: Comes in a 750mL bottle.

element_name: Bittermilk No. 3SMOKY WHISKEY SOUR COCKTAIL SYRUP
description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Forget what you've heard about whiskey sours. When made well, there's almost nothing better, and with this secret-weapon cocktail syrup, you'll have an amazing version at the ready.
Makers Joe and MariElena Raya combine bitter (orange peel), sweet (honey and sugar) and acidic (lemon juice) flavors to build a balanced, sippable bitter. Then, they take this classic and give it one more twist: Bourbon Barrel smoked honey that adds just a wisp of smoke to every sip. 
Hello, happy hour! These cocktails are as easy to make as they are to drink, and we love that the syrup is made with all organic ingredients. We'll drink to that (and did we mention how gorgeous the bottle is?!). 
TIP OF THE TONGUE
We like to pair this syrup with Great Lakes Distillery's Kinnickinnic Whiskey. Just shake equal parts whiskey and cocktail syrup with lots of ice until very cold, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass or a tumbler with fresh ice. Garnish with an orange peel, and if you're feeling extra fancy, a Mess Hall Cocktail Cherry. Cheers!
ingredients: Organic lemon juice, water, bourbon barrel smoked organic honey, organic cane sugar, orange oleo saccharum (organic orange peel, organic cane sugar).
certification: Comes in a 17 oz bottle.

description: Pour on the Southern hospitality with cocktails mixed in this all-American Mason jar shaker. Created by W+P Design, it's the brainchild of two gents who grew up below the Mason-Dixon Line and know a few things about mint juleps and fine bourbon whiskey. Retrofitted with a strainer and cap, the roomy glass jar holds plenty of ice for perfectly chilled, ultracool cocktails.
certification: Crafted from a classic Mason jar.
Durable stainless-steel screw top, strainer and cap.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
City of Daughters spawned from a famous cocktail bar called Elsa in New York's East Village. After slinging re-imagined takes on classic cocktails since 2008, the husband and wife team behind Elsa (Jay Schneider and Natalka Burian) decided to bring the unique experience of Elsa to everyone's home. Made in Brooklyn with only the finest, freshest ingredients, this is a true grenadine with the brilliant, gorgeous addition of organic rose hips.
Most grenadines found in grocery stores get their red hue from artificial ingredients – City and Daughters gets its red tine from tart, sweet pomegranate juice, just like the old classic grenadines. And no high fructose corn syrup allowed.  
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Mix a classic Jack Rose: 2 ounces applejack, 3/4 ounces Elsa's Rose Hip Grenadine, and 3/4 ounce fresh lemon juice. Shake with ice; strain into a chilled glass, coupe preferred. Garnish with a lemon or lime wheel. Cheers!
ingredients: Pomegranate juice, organic pure cane sugar, orange blossom water, organic rose hips, organic rose petals.
certification: Comes in an 8 oz. bottle.
Refrigerate after opening.

description: Constructed of die-cast aluminum, OXO's sturdy citrus squeezer fully extracts the juice from lemon and lime halves. The soft, nonslip handles absorb pressure and provide a firm grip.
certification: Fully extracts juice from lemon and lime halves.

Soft, nonslip handles ensure a comfortable grip.
Strong, die-cast aluminum construction.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
It takes over 60 pounds of fresh apples to produce one of these bottles of Applejack! First, Harvest Spirits makes hard cider, which they use in both their applejack and their vodka. That hard cider is distilled twice, then aged for two years in bourbon barrels to make this apple-licious brandy.
The final product has a rich apple flavor that makes a great cocktail, but it also has a lot of vanilla and oak flavors similar to a fine aged bourbon.
Cornelius is the fancy version of a traditional spirit made more for swillin' than sipping! But one of our favorite things about the indie spirits boom is that distillers are making amazing versions of spirits that were traditionally pretty rough.
TIP OF THE TONGUE
This is a really fun spirit to pair with dessert. It goes well with a wide range of flavors, from an apple pie or crumble to chocolate cake to a summer berry bread pudding.
certification: 40% alcohol by volume.
Comes in a 750ml bottle.

description: Experts with the world's most discerning palates helped develop Riedel's Vinum series, a collection of glasses designed to flatter specific types of wines and liquors. These elegant lead-crystal glasses enhance the pleasure of a well-made martini. The iconic flared bowl is the classic size favored by fine European hotels and martini traditionalists, who prefer a smaller glass because it holds the ideal volume for a single martini. A family-owned company since 1756, Riedel produces the machine-made Vinum series at its factory in Germany.
certification: Made in Germany.
Dishwasher safe.
4.6-oz. cap., 5 3/4" high.
Set of two.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Q Drinks started experimenting with a mixture of real ginger, organic agave and some special flavors like coriander, cardamom, cayenne, rose oil and orange peel. They agonized and tinkered until they came up with a beverage that tastes nothing like the corn syrup and chemicals that you're used to. You will love the crisp flavor and, because it's not so sugary sweet, there are only 60 calories. Plus, it comes in a beautiful frosted glass bottle worthy of the top shelf. 
TIP OF THE TONGUE
The real ginger sometimes sinks to the bottom, so shake gently before opening! Great spiked with a little rum.
ingredients: Triple purified water, organic agave, ginger extract, extracts of lemon juice, coriander, cardamon, cayenne, orange peel, rose oil.
certification: Comes in a 750 ml bottle.

description: Maraschino cherries go back to their Italian roots. Produced in Luxardo, Italy, these cherries are nothing like the bright red orbs you find in cocktails from workaday bars. Dense and chewy with a sweet-tart flavor, these maraschino cherries are made with prized sour marasca cherries preserved in the fruit's famed liqueur. They'll take your Manhattan (or Shirley Temple) to new heights and are also delicious spooned with their rich syrup over ice cream or cheesecake.
ingredients: Marasca cherries, sugar, marasca cherry juice, glucose, citric acid, natural color, Maraschino natural flavor.
certification: Made in Italy.

description: One of the essentials of any well-equipped home bar, our conical-shaped beer glasses hold a full pint. Your single- or triple-initial monogram adds a handsome finishing touch.
certification: Dishwasher safe.
16-oz. cap., 5 3/4" high.
A Williams-Sonoma exclusive.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Jennie Ripps and Maria Littlefield started out as tea aficionados who loved to customize their blends (they also run The Teaologist, a boutique tea site focused on blending teas, fruits and spices). 
Owl's Brew, their new breakthrough line of tea concentrates, makes it that much easier to mix up a batch of complex, refreshing, healthful tea cocktails come 5 o'clock. Yes tea cocktails. Tea lends a complexity of flavor that will impress even the snobbiest of drinkers.
We call them "tea-tails."
THE CLASSIC
English Breakfast with a tart twist! If you drink an Arnold Palmer with your lunch, you'll be very happy with this during happy hour. Mix two parts of the tea concentrate with one part vodka, tequila or gin, stir over ice or shake and strain, then garnish with a lemon or lime twist. 
PINK & BLACK
Smoky darjeeling brightened up by tart hibiscus, like something you'd drink at one of those cool speakeasy-style bars (this one's so cool, only you know about it!). Mix one part of the tea concentrate with one part whiskey, tequila or vodka, stir over ice or shake and strain, then garnish with a lemon twist.
ingredients: The Classic: Brewed tea (water, black tea, lemon peel), agave, lemon juice, lime juice, citric acid, ascorbic acid. Comes in a 32 fl oz bottle. Pink and Black: Brewed tea (water, darjeeling, hibiscus, lemon peel), agave, strawberry extract, lemon juice, citric acid, ascorbic acid.
certification: Comes in a 32 fl oz bottle.

description: Crushing, or "muddling", limes and mint for cocktails such as mojitos and caipirinhas is easier than ever thanks to this efficient bar tool from OXO. A soft, nonslip grip makes it comfortable to hold. Sturdy, die-cast zinc is weighty and durable, and a nylon head won't scratch glasses.
certification: Thoroughly extracts juices.
Releases aromas and oils from the fruit's rind for maximum citrus flavor.

Soft, comfortable grip.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Call this the bridge between vodka and gin – perfect for bringing all drinkers together around the same punch bowl.
This floral, herbal, citrusy sipper is incredibly well balanced and totally refreshing – plus, it's certified organic! But what is it exactly? Square one starts with organic vodka, distilled from 100% rye, and infuses it with pear, rose, chamomile, lemon verbena, lavender, rosemary, coriander and citrus peel. 
A rye spirit infused with eight different botanicals... that sounds kinda like gin! Well, we can't call this gin, because it doesn't contain the legally-required juniper, but we'll file this one under "a gin by any other name tasting just as delicious."
TIP OF THE TONGUE
We like the sound of his Basil Gimlet riff from Square One: Muddle 4 to 5 basil leaves in the bottle of a cocktail shaker. Add lots of ice, 2 oz Botanical Vodka, 1 oz freshly squeezed lime juice and 1/2 oz organic agave nectar (or simple syrup). Shake until very cold and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Bonus points if you use basil from your garden or your farm share.
ingredients: Distilled from certified organic rye and infused with pear, rose, chamomile, lemon verbena, lavender, rosemary, coriander and citrus peel
certification: 45% alcohol by volume.
Comes in a 750ml bottle.

An innovative smart chip in its 900-watt motor automatically boosts power to the cutting disc under heavier loads, resulting in faster more efficient juice extraction.
certification: Motor provides plenty of power for faster extraction and automatically adjust to heavier loads, operating at 6,500 rpm for soft fruits and leafy greens and up to 12,500 RPM for denser foods.
Backlit control panel is easy to read even in low light.
Extra-wide 3" feed tube is large enough for many whole fruits and vegetables.
Durable and attractive stainless-steel housing is easy to clean.
Special spout separates froth from juice when pouring.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
This liqueur is packed with big-time ginger flavor, made without any extracts or dried spices. Nothing but tons of fresh, spicy, sweet ginger. It's kind of like our favorite candied ginger, but with a measured boozy kick. 
Each batch requires roughly 30 pounds of the spicy root, and it used to take Proof of Concept nearly two days just to get all that peeled, sliced and ready for a month-long steeping in cane-sugar-based spirits. Now, they're up to 200 pounds of the stuff!
We love sipping this all by itself, but the cocktail possibilities are endless.
Founder Josh Morton named the liqueur after Manhattan's Barrow Street, where he invented and perfected his recipe. Then, like all the cool kids, he escaped to Brooklyn to continue making Barrow's Intense Ginger Liqueur.
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Try this refreshing cocktail from the folks at Proof of Concept: Combine 1 oz Ginger Liqueur, 1 oz absinthe (we like Doc's), and 1 oz lemon juice in a rocks glass over ice and stir until cold. Top with a splash of soda and garnish with a lemon twist.
certification: Gluten-free.
22% alcohol by volume.
Comes in a 375ml bottle.

element_name: COOL AS WELL SPARKLING BLANC DE BLANC 2010
description:
MOUTH SAYS...
No celebration is complete without a good bottle of indie bubbles!
This light golden wine has the classic mix of fresh pear and lemon flavors mingling with a slight yeasty hint (fresh-baked brioche, anyone?). 
Blanc de Blanc means "white from white" and is the name for sparkling wines made from 100% Chardonnay. And this one follows the traditional Champagne process méthode champenoise, so it undergoes a second fermentation in the bottle to produce natural carbonation.
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Blanc de Blanc isn't just for special occasions. Its bright flavors and vivid carbonation make it an outstanding aperitif to start off a fancy meal, but sparkling wine is also a fantastic match for Thai or Chinese food.
certification: 12.8% alcohol by volume.
Comes in a 750ml bottle.

element_name: Schott Zwiesel Cru Classic Champagne Flute, Set of 6
description: These Cru Classic flutes from Schott Zweisel are both beautiful and extremely durable, and they will maintain their sparkling clarity through years of daily use. The tall, slim bowls are designed to showcase the bouquet, flavor and bubbles of Champagne and other sparkling wines while the graceful stems are proportioned for optimal stability. Favored by premier restaurants and hotels around the world, this elegant stemware is perfect for entertaining at home.
certification: Classic champagne flutes combine the beauty of crystal with unsurpassed durability.
Patented Tritan titanium technology creates break-, chip- and scratch-resistant stemware.
Dishwasher safe.
Made in Germany by Schott Zwiesel, famous for fine glassware innovations since 1872.
Set of six.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
It's only natural that distilling a good craft beer would eventually make for an excellent whiskey. After all, they both start as fermented grain, and to make whiskey, you start by making beer! This one starts its life as Blue Point Brewing Company's Old Howling Bastard – a big, rich, barley wine-style ale. Then the folks at nearby Long Island Spirits distill it, age it in small oak casks and bring it to proof with water from the aquifer flowing beneath the 100,000-acre Pine Barrens Forest Preserve.
A full-bodied spirit with toffee and vanilla tones, and the hops in the beer add a subtle hint of pine to the background. But it's also surprisingly smooth and sippable for such a young whiskey, making it a great choice for beer lovers or anyone looking for a new twist on an ancient spirit.
TIP OF THE TONGUE
It takes 850 gallons of beer to make just 100 gallons of this whiskey, so we recommend sipping it straight with a hoppy beer chaser to celebrate the circle of life.
ingredients: Distilled from Blue Point Old Howling Bastard beer (malted barley, hops).
certification: 47.5% alcohol by volume.
Comes in a 375ml bottle.

description: Inspired by nearly a century of culinary craftsmanship, Le Creuset is proud to present the Signature collection as the next evolution of its enameled cast-iron cookware. Signature seamlessly blends Le Creuset's classic form and feel with the latest ergonomic and functional innovations.
certification: Its rounded base and high sides make this pan excellent for mixing and cooking sauces.
Optimized for steady, even heat, Le Creuset's improved enamel interior resists staining, dulling and wear and tear.
Enamel interior's light sand color makes it easy to monitor food while cooking, ensuring less sticking and burning.
Stabilizers in the newly engineered lid prevent rocking, keeping the lid snugly in place.
Improved ergonomic, composite knob resists temperatures up to 500°F and provides a sure grip.
Enameled cast-iron construction boasts superior heat-retention and requires no additional seasoning.
Dishwasher safe for fast, convenient cleanup.
A Williams-Sonoma Exclusive.

description: Chase away the winter chill with our clear glass mugs, perfect for mulled wine, hot cider, Irish coffee or a winter cocktail of your own creation.
certification: Dishwasher safe.
15-oz. cap., 5" high.
Set of four.
Made in USA.
A Williams-Sonoma exclusive.

description: Prized by chefs around the globe, Korintje cinnamon is famous for its intense spicy flavor, lively fragrance and rich color. The cinnamon sticks are actually curled "quills" of dried evergreen bark, harvested from trees grown in lush volcanic soil on the slopes of Sumatra's legendary Mt. Korintje. The pristine mountain conditions imbue the spice with an exceptional concentration of aromatic essential oils for rich cinnamon flavor and scent.
ingredients: Whole cinnamon sticks.
certification: 3 oz.
Made in Indonesia.
A Williams-Sonoma exclusive.

description: Margaritas make the party – and our tangy lime margarita salt adds the finishing touch to a knockout margarita. Run a lime wedge along the rim of your glass, dip the moistened rim in our container of lime-flavored sea salt, harvested from the pristine waters of the Pacific Ocean, and let the fiesta begin!
ingredients: Sea salt, cane sugar, crystallized lime (citric acid, evaporated cane juice, lime oil, lime juice, ascorbic acid).
certification: This product is prepared and packaged using machines that may come in contact with wheat/gluten, tree nuts, fish, shellfish, eggs, milk, soy.
10 oz.
Certified Kosher by the Orthodox Union.
Made in USA.

description: Our beautifully designed margarita glasses are now made in the USA from a crystal-clear shatter-resistant polycarbonate that looks like true glass. Because they won't crack or break, the stemmed glasses are perfect for poolside parties, picnics and barbecues.
certification: Set of six glasses for serving margaritas outdoors and poolside.
DuraClear food-grade polycarbonate won't crack, shatter, break, cloud or discolor.
Glasses maintain their clarity even through regular use and washing.
For cold beverages only.
Dishwasher safe.

element_name: Breville Bit More™ Toaster, Long Slot 4-Slice
description: Enjoy toast and bagels just the way you like them, every time. This stainless-steel Breville toaster offers smart design features that make checking and perfecting toast easy, including a special "A Bit More" button that provides just a touch more browning, and a Lift and Look feature lets you check on toasting progress.
certification: Four-slice toaster with advanced features to customize browning.
One-touch A Bit More button for extra browning—push the button once initial toasting is complete, and the bread will automatically lower to continue toasting.
Lift and Look lever raises and lowers carriage so you can check toasting and make midcycle adjustments.
High-lift feature raises the carriage an additional 1/2 inch for removing smaller items.
Variable toaster alert can be adjusted to High, Low or Mute.
Bagel and Frozen settings.
LED progress indicator gives you a visual cue of toasting progress.
Variable browning control.
Slide-out crumb tray for easy cleaning.
Extra-long, extra-wide slots hold a range of breads and are self-centering.
Concealed cord storage.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Meet the peanut butter of Southeast Asia! 
Hey Boo's Cristina Widjaja cooks up her take on the wildly popular Indonesian spread of her childhood in her new hometown, San Francisco, California. These sweet little jars of coconut jam are made by slowly cooking eggs, sugar and coconut milk to creamy, spreadable perfection. 
Cristina's coconut jam gets its beautiful yellow color from the orange-hued yolk of cage-free eggs. It's sweet and tropical, with a melt-in-your-mouth creaminess that we can't get enough of. We'll never give up peanut butter, but this spread is our new favorite alternative to fruity jellies and citrusy marmalades. 
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Spoon up coconut jam, known as srikaya in Indonesia, for a breakfast plate of Malaysian kaya toast. Butter and toast one side of 2 slices of pullman loaf; spread coconut jam on the untoasted sides. Stack and cut like a sandwich, then dip into over-easy eggs and a dash of dark soy sauce.
ingredients: Coconut milk, sugar, egg yolks, sea salt, citric acid, carob gum.
certification: NOTE: Made in a facility that processes nuts and eggs.
Contains treenuts.
Comes in an 8 oz jar.
Refrigerate after opening.

element_name: KitchenAid Stand Mixer Combi Whip & Mixer Bowl
description: When you want to make small batches of batter with your KitchenAid Professional stand mixer, use this convenient half-capacity mixing bowl and combination whisk/flat beater. Also ideal for whipping cream or egg whites, it provides a welcome break from washing the mixer's larger bowl between tasks.
certification: Compatible with KitchenAid Pro 600 and Pro 620 series stand mixers that have a bowl-lift stand.
Convenient 3-qt.-cap. bowl handles a variety of tasks.
Both bowl and whisk/beater are made of rugged stainless steel.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Simple. Deep. Dark. It feels good to bite into little squares* of organic chocolate sourced directly from family-owned farms in Brazil. Fearless Chocolate crafts this dreamy 75% Midnight bar in a low-temperature environment, sealing in natural nutrients and minerals, and a bold, rich flavor.
* We're fans of pre-portioned bites, but that doesn't mean we'll stick to just one...
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Who took a bite out of our chocolate?! Fearless bars are shaped with a "bite" to represent the portion of proceeds they donate to Fearless Changemakers, people and organizations working to make their communities better. Fear not – you still get a full bar of antioxidant-rich, superfood-stuffed chocolate.
ingredients: Organic cacao, organic cane sugar.
certification: NOTE: Made in a facility that also handles dairy, peanuts and soy.
Comes in a 2 oz bar.

description: Distinguished by its clean, delicate flavor, this sea salt is hand harvested from the pristine waters off the coast of Brazil. The mineral-rich crystals have a natural resistance to moisture and clumping, so they're ideal for grinding in salt mills.
ingredients: Sea salt.
certification: Pure white salt, dried using traditional solar techniques, then crushed and strained to ensure uniformly sized crystals.
Ideal for cooking or baking, or as a seasoning at the table.
Made in Brazil.
A Williams-Sonoma exclusive.

description: Only the best vanilla from the island of Madagascar is intense enough for Nielsen-Massey, purveyor of premium pure vanilla products since 1907. Long the choice of bakers and ice-cream makers, this vanilla adds depth and flavor no other vanilla can match.
ingredients: Vanilla Extract: Water, alcohol (35%), sugar, vanilla bean extractives. Vanilla Beans: Whole vanilla beans. Vanilla Paste: Sugar, water, vanilla extract, vanilla beans, gum tragacanth. Vanilla Sugar: Sugar, vanilla bean extractives, silicon dioxide.
certification: Rich, intensely flavored extract is made from select vanilla pods in an exclusive cold-process method; available in 4-oz. and 8-oz. bottles.
Vanilla beans are whole 7" pods, each equivalent to approximately 1 tablespoon of extract; two pods per jar.
Pure vanilla paste is convenient to use and infuses baked goods and ice cream with flavorful flecks of vanilla bean seeds; 4 oz.
Vanilla sugar blends the finest-quality baker's sugar with a hint of vanilla – delicious in coffee or sprinkled atop baked goods; 8.5 oz.
Whole beans imported from Madagascar.
All other products made in USA with imported ingredients.

element_name: Let's Do...Organic Organic Cornstarch, 6-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
description: Let's Do…Organic Cornstarch is a wonderful thickening and stabilizing agent, perfect for making gravy, sauce, custard and so much more To produce Let's Do…Organic Cornstarch we begin with certified organic and GMO-free corn, and we chop its kernels into tiny bits. We wash these chopped kernels with a strong, clean water rinse, then spin in a centrifuge to separate out the starch. After filtering and drying thoroughly, we have a pure organic cornstarch powder, perfect for your baking needs.
ingredients: Organic Cornstarch
certification: A pack of six, 6-Ounce (total of 36-Ounces)
Wheat, Casein and Dairy Free
Organic, Vegan, Gluten free
Certified organic
Made in Austria
Safety Warning: Packed in facility that also packs dairy and soy (not packed on same production line)

Directions: Cornstarch will clump when mixed directly into hot liquids. We recommend you dissolve organic cornstarch in a little cold water before adding it to any hot dish, and then you may heat as desired.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Goat Milk Caramel, also known as cajeta, is a luscious treat. It has a silky texture and a wonderfully complex, tangy flavor. There's almost a roasted nutty bitterness – like the top of a creme brûlée – with the consistency of a rich and creamy sauce. 
Fat Toad Farm is a family affair – mom, dad and daughters working together with their herd of goats at their Vermont farm to create these exceptional caramel sauces.
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Dip apples in it, put a little bit in your coffee or hot chocolate, drizzle over ice cream or grilled fruit. You will likely be holding yourself back from eating it off of a spoon straight from the jar.
ingredients: Goat's milk, organic sugar, organic cornstarch, baking soda.
certification: Original flavor comes in an 8 oz jar.
Cinnamon flavor contains organic cinnamon sticks and comes in a 2 oz jar.
Gluten Free.
Contains dairy.

element_name: Organic Valley, Heavy Whipping Cream, Organic, Pint, 16 oz
description: Dress up your desserts with the freshest, most heavenly organic whipping cream on earth. You'll be dazzled by it's stellar performance in all of your favorite recipes!
ingredients: Organic Grade A Cream (Milk), Carrageenan.
certification: Organic grade A cream

description: Made using traditional methods learned while working on farms in France, Vermont Creamery's Allison Hooper brought her skills back to the US and crafted this exquisitely rich, creamy treat. Creme Fraiche can be used as an ingredient for sauces, pastry, custard, but also stands on its own as a topping on pie, fruits and soups.
certification: Three 8 ounce containers.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Former Bouley pastry chef Lina Kulchinsky makes one of New York City's best pretzels. Everything is baked in small batches using an German-style process and a Mediterranean, Latin and Russian influenced recipe. 
The famous soft pretzels are baked daily in her East Village bakery, and whatever is not sold is seasoned and toasted until golden. These are savory with a hint of sweetness. Crunch with a little give. Fantastic! You will need them everyday.
Why 'Sigmund?' "Balthazar was taken," says the baker.
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Crumble into soups – the very last bite will still be crunchy on the outside! Dip into a jar of Tin Mustard or Peanut Cashew Nut Butter. We've been doing that non-stop when too busy to go out for lunch!
ingredients: Wheat flour, palm oil, brown cane sugar, kosher salt, yeast, seeds (sesame, poppy, sunflower, pumpkin), cheddar cheese, black pepper, black truffles, kalamata olives, feta, rosemary, garlic, parsley, scallions, smoked paprika, olive oil.
certification: Comes in a 6 oz bag.
Contains dairy.
Contains wheat.

description: Coring apples is a smooth and easy task with this ergonomically designed tool. Just line up the shaft with the apple core and gently twist into the fruit, then release the core with the thumb tab.
certification: Efficient prep tool for coring apples and pears.
Polished-stainless-steel shaft has sharp serrated teeth that cut cleanly through fruit.
Quick-release feature allows the core to be released from the shaft easily.
Large polypropylene handle offers a steady grip.
Dishwasher safe.

element_name: Williams-Sonoma Traditional Finish Square Cake Pan, 8"
description: Brownies, bar cookies, corn bread and cakes bake to perfection in our square cake pans. Made for us in the USA, the aluminum-coated steel pans heat quickly and evenly for consistent results.
certification: Versatile pan is ideal for baking cakes, brownies and bar cookies.
Commercial-grade aluminized steel distributes heat quickly and evenly for consistent baking results.
Won't corrode or rust, even with heavy use.
Coated wire reinforcement along the rim maximizes durability and resistance to rust and warping.
Folded construction enhances strength.
Made exclusively for us by a 50-year-old American company, North America's only manufacturer of commercial bakeware.
Recipe included.
A Williams-Sonoma exclusive.

description:
Voluptuous vanilla ice cream. Rich and full-flavored, with notes of jasmine and honey. Made with Direct- and Fair-Trade-Certified African vanilla beans reserved exclusively for Jeni's by Ndali Estate in Uganda.
Ndali Estate Vanilla Bean ice cream used to be called Ugandan Vanilla Bean ice cream. Ndali is pronounced "NUH-dolly."
The vanilla beans for this ice cream are from an Estate in Uganda called Ndali. Lulu Sturdy and her team of growers hand select the beans with THE most vanillin crystals—exclusively for us. We are the only importers of this amazing vanilla in the United States. There's no doubt that this vanilla from Ndali Estate is the most gorgeous, round, full-bodied vanilla flavor and scent that I have ever tasted, and I've certainly had my share of vanilla during the past 19 years in the ice cream business.
certification: Ndali's beans are direct-trade-certified/fair-trade-certified.

description: American pancake lovers have been enjoying Robby's famous buttermilk flapjacks for over 50 years—and with this timesaving mix, they're easy to make at home. Blended using Robby's special family recipe, the premium mix is the secret to incredibly light, fluffy pancakes. Use it to make classic flapjacks or add your favorite fillings—from blueberries, bananas or coconut to decadent chocolate chips.
ingredients: Enriched wheat flour (wheat flour, niacin, iron, thiamine mononitrate, riboflavin, folic acid), corn flour, leavening (baking soda, monocalcium phosphate, sodium acid pyrophosphate), malt powder, salt, sugar, buttermilk, artificial flavor.
certification: 2 lb. 1 oz.
Made in USA.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
This chèvre is quite possibly the best fresh goat's milk cheese we've ever tasted. Thanks to a mellow, lemony goat's milk tang, it is simple, crisp and clean, with far less salt than most others.
Bob Reese of Vermont Creamery always thought he would eventually take the lead of his grandparents' dairy farm. But by the time he'd finished his college degree, they'd already sold the farm. It wasn't until he needed a stellar fresh chèvre for a local dinner he was organizing that he met Allison Hooper. Allison worked at a local dairy lab in Vermont to help supply the cheese, and the rest was cheesy history. Baaaaa.
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Put it on a slice of baguette, put it on a cracker, put it in a salad, put it in an omelet, put it on or in pretty much anything, but make sure you put it in your Mouth.
ingredients: Pasteurized goat's milk; no rennet; aged 2 to 3 weeks; comes in a 4 oz log, 1.25 inches thick by 3.5 inches long.
certification: Contains dairy.

Treat your cheese right! Store it in the fridge tightly wrapped in wax or parchment paper. Take it out and let it warm up to room temperature before serving (about 30 to 60 minutes before). Happy tasting!

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Get your fancy fruit kick all year round without waiting for anything to ripen. Figs may be the Beyonce of this stellar trio but apricots and cherries shine in their supporting roles, just like Kelly and Michelle. 
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Awesome on crackers with sharp cheddar or a stinky blue, but you can also get more creative. Slather it on a turkey sandwich, upgrade a grilled cheese or whisk a spoonful into a pan sauce for duck breast or lamb chops.
ingredients: Dried fruit (fig, apricot, cherry), water, sugar, white wine, lime juice concentrate, vanilla extract, cinnamon.
certification: Comes in an 8 oz jar.

element_name: Strassburger New York Strip Steaks, Set of 4
description: These center cuts have a rich, hearty flavor, making them a favorite on menus everywhere. Hand-selected and expertly finished by Strassburger, a 150-year-old, family-owned New York butcher that supplies some of America's best restaurants – this all-natural beef is raised without hormones or antibiotics. Preparation is simple; the tender, juicy steaks require only a quick turn on the grill or under the broiler.
certification: Four 1"-thick steaks; approx. 14 oz. each.
Shipped frozen.
Product of USA.

description: This special blend of peppercorns combines four colors of peppercorns with allspice berries for a unique and nuanced flavor.
certification: A special blend of Malabar black peppercorns, Sarawak white peppercorns, pink peppercorns and green peppercorns.
Jamaican allspice berries add subtle notes of cinnamon, nutmeg and clove.
Grind or use whole to flavor brines, stocks and more.
A Williams-Sonoma exclusive.

element_name: Cole & Mason Electric Salt & Pepper Mills
description: With these battery-powered mills you can dispense salt or pepper ground to your desired coarseness at the touch of a button. A mini light illuminates the area below the mill – handy for twilight grilling and candlelit dinners.
certification: Easy push-button operation.
Stainless-steel body with a brushed finish.
Durable carbon-steel grinding mechanism for pepper and salt.
An acrylic window displays the contents and fill level.
A mini light illuminates food below the mill as you grind.
Uses six AAA batteries (included).
A Williams-Sonoma exclusive.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Check out the brains of Vermont Creamery: Coupole.
This wrinkly dome has three distinct textures: a buttery rind, the runny, gooey creamline just below the surface, and a dense, sweet milk center. A real crowd-pleaser, this is one of our absolute favorite cheese plate or party cheeses. We get hungry just thinking about it. 
The Coupole also ages beautifully. The older it gets, the more wrinkly it becomes. (Just like us.)
TIP OF THE TONGUE
A must-have on your cheese plate. Top with a drizzle of Bee Local Portland Honey (West Coast, represent!) to pair with the farmyard flavors of the East. It's also amazing melted over a freshly grilled steak.
ingredients: Pasteurized goat's milk; vegetarian rennet; aged about 1 month; comes in a 6.5 oz wheel, 2 inches thick with 2.75-inch diameter.
certification: Contains dairy.

Treat your cheese right! Store it in the fridge tightly wrapped in wax or parchment paper. Take it out and let it warm up to room temperature before serving (about 30 to 60 minutes before). Happy tasting!

description:
FOOD & WINE MAGAZINE SAYS...
This is probably meant as a stir-fry sauce for vegetables, poultry and meat, but it's also great rubbed on a chicken or tofu before roasting or mixed into mayo as a glaze for broiling fish fillets or a sauce for chicken or shrimp salad. – Tina Ujlaki, Executive Food Editor
MOUTH SAYS...
Warm, onion-y, creamy and spicy, this blast of deliciousness makes us feel like we're experts at Indian cooking. The tart sweetness of tamarind, the mild heat of ginger, the complex aromas of the spices and a more intense warmth of chile powder add up to a sauce that is waaaaaay more amazing than we thought any jarred sauce had a right to be!
This is a must-have for any busy human being (human doing?) trying to resist the lure of takeout. 
TIP OF THE TONGUE
For a classic take: Sauté with shrimp, add tomato paste, then add coconut milk and let it simmer until it comes together (optional: Once it's simmering, stir in a couple of handfuls of clean spinach leaves). Serve with jasmine rice or naan.
ingredients: Caramelized onion, water, garlic, tamarind puree, madras spice blend (coriander, cumin, fenugreek, mustard seed, fennel, peppercorn, cardamom, tumeric), organic cane sugar, ginger, organic sunflower oil, sea salt, organic white distilled vinegar, serrano chile, red chile flake, New Mexico chile powder.

description:
All natural organic Chickpeas. Also known as Garbanzo beans. Cook in soups or by themselves. Makes for an extremely healthy side dish.
To cook beans on your stove-top, combine soaked or dried beans, water, oil or fat, and seasonings in a saucepan or pot of appropriate size. Bring the beans to a boil, reduce the heat, then cover and simmer until beans are tender. This takes 30 minutes to 3 hours, depending on the bean variety. Check the beans occasionally to see if they are covered with the cooking liquid. If there is so much liquid absorption and evaporation that the top of the beans becomes exposed, add very hot tap water to the pot to cover the beans. When dried beans boil, a foam forms on the top of the cooking liquid. This foam is water-soluble protein released from the beans and it will be absorbed back into the bean cooking liquid. It is not necessary to remove the foam. (To keep the foam down when cooking beans, add 1 Tablespoon of butter, drippings (consider flavor), or vegetable salad oil, for each cup of beans.
ingredients: Organic garbanzo beans.
certification: Organic
Kosher
Packaged in the same facility as peanuts, tree nuts, wheat, soy, and milk products.
Country of origin: Turkey

element_name: Native Forest Organic Classic Coconut Milk, 13.5-oz. Cans (Count of 12)
description: A staple of Thai, Indian and Caribbean cuisines, Native Forest® Classic Organic Coconut Milk imparts rich and creamy goodness to wonderful regional dishes. In Thailand, devoted farmers are proud to have achieved organic certification of their traditional coconut crop. While organic coconuts are generally smaller than their conventional counterparts, organically managed trees are more robust and drought-resistant, and their soil is more rich and moisture retentive. The first pressing of the fresh organic coconut meat yields an oil-rich extract that is mixed only with filtered water and a tiny amount (less than 1%) of guar gum from the seeds of the guar plant. The result is Native Forest® Classic Organic Coconut Milk, a delicious ingredient in soups, curries, sauces, desserts, and beverages. It may also replace dairy milk or cream in some of your favorite American recipes with excellent results.
ingredients: Certified Organic Coconut Milk (organic coconut, water, organic guar gum).
certification: Pack of twelve, 13.5 ounces each (total of 162 ounces)
Imparts rich and creamy goodness to wonderful regional dishes
A staple of Thai, Indian and Caribbean cuisines

Directions: Store at room temperature and shake well before using. Once opened, refrigerate and use within 4 days. Product may to separate when its temperature falls below 80 degrees F. This makes the milk appear curdled as the coconut fat separates from the liquid. Such separation is harmless and easily remedied by placing the can of coconut milk in hot water for 15 minutes and then stirring the contents thoroughly.

description: With its light aroma, mild flavor and rich in fatty acids, coconut oil is a wonderful complement to baking and cooking. Rich, creamy and free of trans fats and cholesterol, it performs beautifully in place of butter and shortening, and adds distinctive taste to stir-fries and sautés. Our organic, raw oil is prepared from fresh organic coconut meat, cold pressed and bottled in its pure, unrefined state—the result is a flavorful, creamy oil with its natural nutrients intact.
ingredients: Expeller-pressed naturally unrefined extra-virgin coconut oil.
certification: Unrefined, non-hydrogenated and free of chemicals, preservatives and trans fats.
Prepared at temperatures below 118°F, the oil is a pure, raw food.
Naturally cholesterol free.
Solid at room temperature; melts to a clear liquid.
Use instead of butter in baking, stir-fries and sautés.
Delicious in smoothies, drizzled over popcorn and in homemade mayonnaise.
Certified organic and kosher.
11.5 fl. oz.

description:
All natural, dried, unsweetened organic coconut chips with nothing added. These organic coconut chips have a mild flavor and light, crisp texture that is perfect for your recipes. They are great for baking, cooking, granola, or anything that requires coconut. Our unsweetened coconut chips are certified organic by CCOF.
Health Benefits of Organic Coconut Chips
Adding unsweetened organic coconut to oatmeal, baked goods, and your other favorite foods is a great way to increase your fiber intake. The dietary fiber in unsweetened coconut supports your digestive system and helps you feel full to prevent overeating. It is also a rich source of iron, which delivers oxygen-rich blood cells throughout the body and wards off fatigue. Organic coconut chips are high in the immune-boosting mineral zinc to support your body's natural defense system against illness.
ingredients: Organic Coconut.
certification: Organic
Kosher
Gluten-free
Non-GMO
Packaged in the same facility as peanuts, tree nuts, soy, and milk products.
Country of origin: Philippines

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Kari Morris first fell in love with ginger syrup when staying with friends in the south of France and came home inspired to make her own. Ginger is juiced and combined with exactly the right amount of sugar, then reduced to perfection in a process Kari describes as "procure-clean-juice-strain-boil-skim-bottle-cool-label-stamp-deliver and repeat."
When you can finally bring yourself to open that gorgeous, leave-on-the-counter-worthy amber bottle, you'll absolutely fall in love with the delicious, potent gingery elixir. 
TIP OF THE TONGUE
An easy Dark and Stormy, brought to you by Morris Kitchen: 2 oz dark rum, 1/2 oz Morris Kitchen Ginger Syrup, 1 oz lime, 3 oz seltzer. Garnish with a lime wheel and enjoy.
ingredients: Ginger, sugar.

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Glory, glory, hallelujah!
This gin is just as tasty with tonic as it is in a strong cocktail.
While all gins must contain juniper, a distiller can add any other botanicals they want to craft their own unique flavor. Most distillers keep the recipe secret, but our neighbors at Breuckelen Distilling proudly revealed their secrets –  lemon, rosemary, ginger and grapefruit.
Unlike many gins that are basically infused vodkas, Breuckelen's gin is distilled from wheat grown in upstate New York, so the base is really more like a white whiskey. In fact, they barrel-age the same wheat spirit to make their 77 Whiskey.  
TIP OF THE TONGUE
The warm ginger note makes it just right paired with Morris Kitchen's ginger syrup. For a deliciously easy cocktail, combine 2 oz gin, 1 oz syrup and 1/2 oz lemon juice over ice and stir until cold, then top with a little seltzer.
DID YOU KNOW?
Gin can be infused with a wide variety of botanicals, but it MUST contain juniper berries, which are responsible for that distinct, piney, gin-y flavor.
ingredients: Distilled from 100% wheat grown in upstate New York.
certification: 45% alcohol by volume.
Comes in a 750ml bottle.

description: Cucumbers: Cultivated for more than 3,000 years, first in India, this cool, crunchy member of the gourd family grows in vines on the ground, but reaches lofty heights in recipes like tzatziki, the Greek yogurt dish.
ingredients: Cucumber
certification: Grown in Canada or Mexico.
How to store: Keep a cuke's high moisture content intact by placing it in a plastic bag in the refrigerator. Use within a week.

How to prep: Rinse under cool, running water. Remove peel with a vegetable peeler or a paring knife. Some recipes require the removal of the seeds, which is a snap if you cut the cucumber in half, lengthwise, and use a spoon to gently scrape them out.
Chef's tip: Place slices of cucumber in a pitcher and fill with water for a thirst quencher that's often served at high-end spas.

description: Fresh Herbs: Prized by chefs and home cooks for their ability to boost flavor, herbs such as basil, mint, tarragon and thyme are essential to all sorts of recipes including pesto and classic béchamel sauce.
ingredients: Mint
certification: Grown in United States, Mexico or Columbia.

How to store: Treat tender herbs with care, keeping them cool. Snip the stems ends and place them in a jar, like flowers. Herbs like basil, mint, and parsley can also be stored in special produce bags to maintain the maximum fresh flavor.

How to prep: Rinse under cool, running water and pat dry with a towel or whirl in a salad spinner. Hardy herbs such as thyme and rosemary are best when chopped or cut with kitchen shears, while many chefs prefer to tear off pieces of tender herbs like basil and mint by hand.
Chef's tip: When creating herb-focused recipes like pesto, always make a double batch and freeze the leftovers.

element_name: king arthur unbleached bread flour - 5 lb.
description:
King Arthur's unbleached, unbromated, high-gluten bread flour, milled from hard red spring wheat grown chiefly in the Dakotas, is perfect for yeasted baked goods-bread, rolls, pizza, and more.
Protein level: 12.7%, a full point higher than other national brands.
The higher the protein level, the stronger the rise. Excellent companion for whole grain flours: try pairing it with rye or whole wheat, and see the difference it makes in your breads.
King Arthur Unbleached Bread Flour: for more POP in your yeast breads, rolls, and pizza.
certification: 5-pound bag.
dietary information: Kosher.

kitchen tips: High-protein flour absorbs more liquid than medium-protein flour. When baking with bread flour, add about 2 teaspoons extra liquid for each cup of flour (or more, in order to produce dough that's the consistency the recipe calls for.) Super when you're making rye or other whole-grain breads that have trouble rising their highest.

element_name: king arthur white whole wheat flour - 5 lb.
description: Trying to get whole grain goodness into your diet? King Arthur's 100% white whole wheat is lighter whole wheat, with 100% of the nutrition! Makes lighter-colored, milder-tasting baked goods. Perfect for cookies, bars, bread, muffins, pancakes… all your favorite baked goods. Use as you would traditional whole wheat flour.
certification: Protein level: 13%.
Milled from hard white spring wheat, rather than traditional red wheat.
In 5-pound bag.
care + storage: For freshest taste, store in freezer.

kitchen tips: Whole grains in baking need more moisture and more time, to allow the sharp edges of the bran to absorb moisture, which improves baking characteristics. When first using this flour, try substituting it for 1/3 of the white flour in your recipe; see how you like the results. If you want to increase the whole grain flour in your recipe, add another tablespoon or so of liquid to your dough or batter, and let it rest for 20 to 30 minutes before baking for best results.

element_name: CABERNET SAUVIGNON / PETITE SYRAH MOUNTS BENCH VINEYARD 2007
description:
MOUTH SAYS...
Big and full-bodied, with lots of ripe fruit and a hint of black pepper and vanilla, this is a classic "Cali Cab Sav blend" with enough age to show off delicious maturity.
Nothing says California red wine like predominately Cabernet Sauvignon aged in oak casks. And this mix of 75% Cab Sav with 25% Petite Syrah is truly one of the best we've ever tasted. The 2 grape varietals grow next to each other in the vineyard in California's Dry Creek Valley which makes them a perfect compliment to each other, and the wine spends 20 months in French oak before bottling. (Ah, retirement.)
The folks at Old World make wines that not only taste wonderful, but also are true to their vineyards. They never add yeast because they think the native yeast better expresses the wine's origins, much like soil and growing conditions tie grapes to certain regions.
TIP OF THE TONGUE
We were thrilled to get a Cabernet blend this good, with this much age, for this price. Grab one to drink now and one to open in a few more years.
ingredients: 75% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Petite Syrah.
certification: 12.4% alcohol by volume.
Comes in a 750ml bottle.

For a classic Italian finishing touch, sprinkle the chili flakes over fresh-baked pizza.

description:
Dry but fruity flavors of pear, quince and grapefruit gain complexity from notes of green thyme and smoky volcanic rock.
Story: Reds from Sicily's Mount Etna have been impressing for years now, but the region also makes excellent white wines. The main varieties, Carricante and Catarratto, are indigenous and obscure, yet they wonderfully evoke a unique winegrowing environment: the terroir of an active volcano. Still erupting with a continuously visible plume of smoke, the 10,900-foot summit of Mount Etna possesses a vastly cooler climate than that of the sea-level vineyards below. That, combined with the area's minerally, volcanic soils, makes for an extreme grape-growing environment that stresses vines into producing extraordinary wine. Sure, vineyards are occasionally lost to lava flows, but many old vines survive to produce wines that have the acid, structure and precision people usually associate with northern Italian wines. We think that Etna is one of the most compelling regions in the world, and this crisp bottling does it great credit.
Sense: The nose brings together scents of yellow plum, pear and lemon verbena with hints of seashells and minerals.
Savor: Dry but fruity flavors of pear, quince and grapefruit gain complexity from notes of green thyme and smoky volcanic rock.
Serve: This wine has the tightness, high acidity and aggressive minerality to be compelling on its own as an aperitif. But that same stony texture and lemon-tinged bite make it wonderful with food, especially fresh fish and seafood. Serve white-fleshed fish, scallops, shrimp, clams—whatever you can find from the sea—simply with lemon, capers, olive oil, herbs and other Mediterranean seasonings for a great first course or a satisfying light meal.
Serving Instructions: Serve well chilled - refrigerate the bottle for 45 minutes before serving.
certification: VARIETY: Carricante
REGION: Etna, Italy
TYPE: Crisp Light-Bodied White

description:
MOUTH SAYS...
We've never sipped a tall, cool glass of water taken straight from a limestone spring, but we imagine it's something like this refreshing white wine. Crisp, citrusy, cool and minerally.
This dry, 100% riesling is the vineyard's signature wine, and we taste why. It's fermented in small batches, which are blended together to ensure consistent flavor and texture. 
Hermann J. Wiemer was one of the first people to realize that the climate and soil in the Finger Lakes area of New York is similar to that of the Mosel Valley in Germany, which is famous for riesling. And the winery he founded makes world-class beauties from classic German grapes that we thoroughly enjoy.
TIP OF THE TONGUE
Sweet rieslings might be more well-known, but we think dry varieties are much more versatile. This is a great introduction to the style.
certification: 12% alcohol by volume.
